subtitle: paper 146 the first preaching tour of
galilee
the first public preaching tour of
galilee began on sunday january 18
1828 and continued for about two months
ending with the return to capernaum on
march 17th
on this tour jesus and the twelve
apostles assisted by the former apostles
of john
preached the gospel and baptized
believers in rahman
jota pata rama zaboolan
in these cities they tarried and taught
while in many other smaller towns
they proclaimed the gospel of the
kingdom as they passed through
this was the first time jesus permitted
his associates to preach without
restraint
on this tour he cautioned them on only
three occasions
he admonished them to remain away from
nazareth and to be discreet when passing
through capernaum and tiberius
it was a source of great satisfaction to
the apostles at last
to feel they were at liberty to preach
and teach without restriction
and they threw themselves into the work
of preaching the gospel
ministering to the sick and baptizing
believers with great earnestness and joy
preaching at rahman the small city of
vermont had once been dedicated to the
worship of a babylonian god of air
roman many of the earlier babylonian and
later zoroastrian teachings
were still embraced in the beliefs of
the ramanites
therefore did jesus and the 24 devote
much of their time to the task of making
plain
the difference between these older
beliefs and the new gospel of the
kingdom
peter here preached one of the great
sermons of his early career on
aaron and the golden calf although many
of the citizens of vermont became
believers in jesus teaching
they made great trouble for their
brethren in later years
it is difficult to convert nature
worshipers to the full fellowship
of the adoration of a spiritual ideal
during the short space of a single
lifetime
many of the better of the babylonian and
persian ideas of light and darkness
good and evil time and eternity were
later incorporated into the doctrines of
so-called christianity
and their inclusion rendered the
christian teaching more immediately
acceptable to the people the near east
in like manner the inclusion of many of
plato's theories
of the ideal spirit or invisible
patterns of all things visible and
material
as later adapted by philo to the hebrew
theology
made paul's christian teachings more
easy of acceptance
by the western greeks it was at ramon
that toten first heard the gospel of the
kingdom and he later carried this
message into mesopotamia
and far beyond he was among the first to
preach the good news to those who dwelt
beyond the euphrates
at jota potter while the common people
of jyotipata heard jesus and his
apostles gladly
and many accepted the gospel the kingdom
it was the discourse of jesus to the 24
on the second evening of their sojourn
in this small town that distinguishes
the jodopoda mission
nathaniel was confused in his mind about
the master's teaching concerning prayer
thanksgiving and worship and in response

length and further explanation of his
teaching
summarized in modern phraseology this
discourse may be presented as
emphasizing the following points
one the conscious and persistent regard
for inequity in the heart of man
gradually destroys the prayer connection
of the human soul
with the spirit circuits of
communication between man and his maker
naturally god hears the petition of his
child but when the human heart
deliberately and persistently harbors
the concepts of inequity
there gradually ensues a loss of
personal communion
between the earth child and his heavenly
father
two that prayer which is inconsistent
with the known and established laws of
god
is an abomination to the paradise
deities
if man will not listen to the gods as
they speak to their creation in the laws
of spirit
mind and matter the very act of such
deliberate and conscious disdain
by the creature turns the ears of spirit
personalities away from hearing the
personal petitions
of such lawless and disobedient mortals

prophet zechariah
but they refused to hearken and pulled
away the shoulder
and stopped their ears that they should
not hear
yes they made their hearts adamant like
a stone lest they should hear my law
and words which i sent by my spirit

therefore did the results of their evil

and so it came to pass that they cried

open to hear and then jesus called the

he who turns away his ear from hearing
the divine law
even as prayer shall be an abomination
three by opening the human end of the
channel of the god-man communication
mortals make immediately available the
ever-flowing streams of divine ministry
to the creatures of the worlds when man
hears god's spirit
speak within the human heart inherent in
such an experience is the fact that god
simultaneously hears that man's prayer
even the forgiveness of sin operates in

the father in heaven has forgiven you
even before you have thought to ask him
but such forgiveness is not available in

until such a time as you forgive your
fellow men
god's forgiveness in fact is not
conditioned about your forgiving your
fellows
but in experience it is exactly so
conditioned
and this fact of the synchrony of divine

was us recognized and linked together in

4. there is a basic law of justice in

the unselfish glories of paradise are
not possible of reception
by a thoroughly selfish creature of the
realm of time and space
even the infinite love of god cannot
force the salvation of eternal survival

there are mandates of justice which even

judge not that you not be judged with

you also shall be judged
mercy does not wholly abrogate universe
fairness
in the end it will prove true whoso

he also so someday cry for help and no
one will hear him
the sincerity of any prayer is the

the spiritual wisdom and universe
consistency of any petition
is the determiner of the time manner and

what the true son desires and the

guard against the great danger of

even when all goes well with your soul
